intro: Crepis macrocephala f. longifolia, commonly known as the long-leaved mouse-ear, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features basal rosettes of narrow, silver-gray leaves and produces small, yellow flowers arranged in a single head. It thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in open, sunny habitats. This form is distinguished by its elongated leaves compared to the typical variety of Crepis macrocephala.
